dmca.title: [ABUSE] notice of trademark abuse]
dmca.body:
T

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Sunday, January 29, 2006 5:23 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; bzialcita@cbbb.bbb.org
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] notice of trademark abuse]

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

-------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] notice of trademark abuse
Date:         Fri, 27 Jan 2006 12:41:52 -0500
From:         Zialcita, Beth <bzialcita@cbbb.bbb.org>
To:         <abuse@theplanet.com>



January 27, 2006



Abuse Department                                         by electronic mail

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

1333 North Stemmons Freeway, Suite 1110

Dallas, TX  75207


Dear Sir or Madam:

I am an attorney for the Council of Better Business Bureaus, Inc. (the
Council), the umbrella organization for Better Business Bureaus throughout
the United States.  Part of my job involves monitoring the Internet for
impermissible uses of the Council's BBBONLINE RELIABILITY Logo.  It has come
to my attention that ThePlanet.com Internet Services hosts the web site for
an Internet site called Get Wet International in Pismo Beach, CA.  On this
company's web site located at www.getwet.com, the BBBONLINE RELIABILITY Logo
is displayed without our permission.

The Santa Barbara, CA BBB and the Council have contacted the owner of the
site to request removal of our trademark from this web site without success.
This company is not a BBB member or a BBBOnLine Reliability program
participant and so this use of our trademark constitutes trademark
infringement as well as false advertising. We are concerned that the public
will be misled about this company's status with the BBB if they continue to
display our trademark.  Given our failed efforts to contact the site's
owner, I write to you to request that you, as web host, remove the BBBONLINE
RELIABILITY Logo from the site mentioned above.

In case you are unaware, the Council is the owner of the BBBONLINE
RELIABILITY Logo in the United States (Reg. Nos. 2,638,567, 2,638,568,
2,653,511, and 2,653,512).  This mark may only be used in limited ways by
authorized members that have entered into a licensing agreement with an
approved BBB.  It is essential that we protect it from infringement or
misuse and the public from misunderstandings about the relationship of
companies with the BBB.



I trust that you understand how important it is for the Council to protect
its marks, and I thank you for your help.

Sincerely,





Victoria Doran

Deputy General Counsel



cc:  R. Copelan, Santa Barbara, CA BBB

     E. Davis, Dallas, TX BBB





<<im4511_20060128_010925.pdf>>


--
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
dmca.principal_name: Council of Better Business Bureaus, Inc.
